content:
• Friday, November 25, 2011
  • QRVO

    TriQuint Semiconductor (TQNT +1.5%) posts a modest gain after DA Davidson upped the shares to...

    TriQuint Semiconductor (TQNT +1.5%) posts a modest gain after DA Davidson upped the shares to Buy from Neutral earlier today, citing valuation and expectations for a long-term rebound.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • S

    Shares of high beta/high debt mobile wireless stocks are taking a hit today: Sprint Nextel...

    Shares of high beta/high debt mobile wireless stocks are taking a hit today: Sprint Nextel Corporation (S -4%), Leap Wireless (LEAP -3.2%) and Clearwire (CLWR -0.3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • OVTI

    OmniVision Technologies (OVTI -4%) is making new 52-week lows, after Wedbush (Neutral) slashes...

    OmniVision Technologies (OVTI -4%) is making new 52-week lows, after Wedbush (Neutral) slashes its PT ahead of Tuesday's FQ2 report. The firm thinks FQ2 results will be in-line with the numbers preannounced 2 weeks ago, but expect FQ3 guidance to be below Street estimates, given macro troubles, market share losses, and low chip manufacturing yields.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Internet stocks are selling off, with Netflix (NFLX -6.6%), LinkedIn (LNKD -3.8%), and Groupon...

    Internet stocks are selling off, with Netflix (NFLX -6.6%), LinkedIn (LNKD -3.8%), and Groupon (GRPN -4.3%) all adding to their recent bloodletting. Amazon (AMZN -3.8%) and eBay (EBAY -1.3%) are also moving lower, in spite of positive Thanksgiving e-commerce data.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 2 Comments
  • RASF

    RAIT Financial Trust (RAS +1.8%) gains after announcing it's entered into a new $150M facility...

    RAIT Financial Trust (RAS +1.8%) gains after announcing it's entered into a new $150M facility with Barclays Capital. The company intends to use the facility to finance Commercial Backed Mortgage Securities and eligible commercial real estate loans.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • X

    United States Steel (X +0.1%) is urging its shareholders to reject an unsolicited mini-tender...

    United States Steel (X +0.1%) is urging its shareholders to reject an unsolicited mini-tender offer from TRC Capital. TRC is attempting to acquire up to 3M shares of the company's stock at $24.50 per share. Other companies have faced mini-tender offers from TRC this year and recommended that their shareholders reject them, including: Adobe (ADBE -0.1%) and PPL (PPL +0.9%).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • PCRFY

    Panasonic (PC +3.8%) trades up after announcing plans to establish a company in Malaysia that...

    Panasonic (PC +3.8%) trades up after announcing plans to establish a company in Malaysia that will serve as its new solar manufacturing base. Panasonic Energy Malaysia, to be set up in December, will operate a vertically-integrated solar manufacturing facility producing from wafers to cells and modules.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • SNE

    Many large-cap Japanese ADRs are up strongly, and Sony (SNE +5.1%), whose shares closed on...

    Many large-cap Japanese ADRs are up strongly, and Sony (SNE +5.1%), whose shares closed on Wednesday near an 18-year low, is among the top performers. The company announced the European launch titles for its upcoming PlayStation Vita handheld console earlier this week, and is hinting the PlayStation 4 will arrive around the same time as the next-gen Xbox (NASDAQ:MSFT), which is expected to hit stores in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • LYG

    In spite of the bad news from Italy, major U.K. banks are rallying strongly today, perhaps...

    In spite of the bad news from Italy, major U.K. banks are rallying strongly today, perhaps bolstered by Lloyd's (LYG +6.7%) deal on Thursday to sell $1.75B in distressed loan assets. RBS +9.3%. BCS +5.4%. Their American counterparts aren't doing too badly either. GS +2.1%. MS +2.8%. BAC +2.4%. C +2.6%. WFC +1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • ATU

    Actuant (ATU +1.2%) gets a boost after S&P raises its outlook to positive from stable,...

    Actuant (ATU +1.2%) gets a boost after S&P raises its outlook to positive from stable, saying the company's credit measures have stayed stronger than previously expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • MBT

    Mobile TeleSystems (MBT +4%) trades up after UBS raises its rating to Buy on the shares, citing...

    Mobile TeleSystems (MBT +4%) trades up after UBS raises its rating to Buy on the shares, citing the company's solid growth and reliable dividend stream. UBS notes that Russian service revenue grew 7.8% Y/Y in Q3 despite cost-cutting measures, and data revenue is consistently growing 50%. If this continues, it could support a higher growth multiple in 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • IMAX

    Imax (IMAX +3.5%) trades higher after announcing it's signed a revenue-sharing deal with British...

    Imax (IMAX +3.5%) trades higher after announcing it's signed a revenue-sharing deal with British chain Cineworld to open three new theaters. The theaters will be installed in existing multiplexes in Edinburgh, Sheffield and Nottingham and will bring the number of Imax locations in the U.K. to 20.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • GYRO

    Gyrodyne (GYRO +21%) pops after the New York supreme court affirms the judgment of a lower court...

    Gyrodyne (GYRO +21%) pops after the New York supreme court affirms the judgment of a lower court requiring the State to pay the company an additional $99M in compensation for its 245 acres of its Flowerfield property in St. James and Stony Brook, New York, taken by the State after paying just $26M for the property. The court also says the state must pay an additional 9% statutory interest from the date it took the property.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • GDOT

    Green Dot (NYSE:GDOT), a provider of prepaid debit cards, is up 2.3% following a positive note...

    Green Dot (NYSE:GDOT), a provider of prepaid debit cards, is up 2.3% following a positive note from Wedbush. The firm believes Green Dot is "on track for 25%+ long-term growth," and sees no major regulatory or competitive threats on the horizon. Wedbush also expects new products to arrive over the next few months.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • CMM

    Shares of China Mass Media (CMM -7.2%) dip after saying its three-year advertising agency...

    Shares of China Mass Media (CMM -7.2%) dip after saying its three-year advertising agency contracts with China Central Television for the Daytime Advertising Package and Television Guides program will not be renewed. The loss of revenues from these two contracts are expected to heavily impact FY12 results.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • SLB

    Crude oil futures catch a tailwind off the move higher in equities this morning, pushing to a...

    Crude oil futures catch a tailwind off the move higher in equities this morning, pushing to a session high near $97 a barrel and taking energy shares along for the ride: Schlumberger (SLB +1.6%), ExxonMobil (XOM +0.7%), BP (BP +0.7%), Marathon Oil (MRO +0.7%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • GYRO

    Gyrodyne (GYRO +22.9%) takes off after stating a New York appeals court has affirmed a June 2010...

    Gyrodyne (GYRO +22.9%) takes off after stating a New York appeals court has affirmed a June 2010 ruling requiring the state to pay the REIT $98.7 plus "statutory interest" for property acquired in 2006 via eminent domain.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • LYB

    Plastics and chemical refinier LyondellBasell (LYB +2%) gains after declaring a special dividend...

    Plastics and chemical refinier LyondellBasell (LYB +2%) gains after declaring a special dividend of $4.50 per share, along with its quarterly dividend of $0.25 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • POZN

    Drug developer Pozen (POZN +40%) soars after reporting late Wednesday that it sold the U.S....

    Drug developer Pozen (POZN +40%) soars after reporting late Wednesday that it sold the U.S. royalty rights from its migraine drug Treximet to Canada's national pension fund, CPPIB Credit Investments.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • AMRN

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) gains 5% after announcing the FDA has accepted a New Drug Application for...

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) gains 5% after announcing the FDA has accepted a New Drug Application for its AMR101 drug, which aims to treat patients with high triglyceride levels. Shares rose last week on positive Phase 3 trial data.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • IOC

    InterOil (NYSE:IOC) is up 6.9% after the company announces it's signed a deal with Gunvor...

    InterOil (NYSE:IOC) is up 6.9% after the company announces it's signed a deal with Gunvor Singapore to supply 1M tons/year of liquefied natural gas from its Papua New Guinea project. InterOil shares were hammered in September after its original plans for the Papua New Guinea project ran into government resistance.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM

  • Yields sky-rocket to an average of 6.5% as Italy sells €8B ($10.7B) worth of 6-month bills,...

    Yields sky-rocket to an average of 6.5% as Italy sells €8B ($10.7B) worth of 6-month bills, up from 3.35% in October, with the bid-to-cover ratio dropping to 1.47 from 1.57. In an auction of €2B worth of 2-year zero-coupon bonds, the yield soared to 7.814% from 4.628%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 AM | 2 Comments

  • European shares turn lower, apparently due to the FT's report that the eurozone rescue fund will...

    European shares turn lower, apparently due to the FT's report that the eurozone rescue fund will fall "well short of its billing." Euro STOXX 50 -0.5%, London -0.4%, Paris -0.6%, Frankfurt -0.5%, Milan -1%, Madrid -0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 AM

  • German bunds stabilize as December futures rise 9 ticks to 135.14, while 10-year yields fall 2.5...

    German bunds stabilize as December futures rise 9 ticks to 135.14, while 10-year yields fall 2.5 bps to 2.169%. "Bunds are really just too cheap at the moment," says a trader. "The market is trading like it expects armageddon and equities are trading like they expect some sort of muddle through, but bunds are usually right."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 AM

  • The euro hits a new seven-week low of $1.3298 following yesterday's disappointing meeting...

    The euro hits a new seven-week low of $1.3298 following yesterday's disappointing meeting between Merkel, Sarkozy and Monti. The euro has lost around 1.5% this week, and with international asset managers pulling out the eurozone, the market is braced for further weakness. Euro now -0.3% at $1.3307.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 AM
